item.title: Joy add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "And now," cried Max, "let the wild rumpus start!" -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Joy add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "Oh, please don't go—we'll eat you up—we love you so!" -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Joy add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "You cannot write for children. They're much too complicated. You can only write books that are of interest to them. " -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Joy add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "Once a little boy sent me a charming card with a little drawing on it. I loved it. I answer all my children’s letters — sometimes very hastily — but this one I lingered over. I sent him a card and I drew a picture of a Wild Thing on it. I wrote, “Dear Jim: I loved your card.” Then I got a letter back from his mother and she said, “Jim loved your card so much he ate it.” That to me was one of the highest compliments I’ve ever received. He didn’t care that it was an original Maurice Sendak drawing or anything. He saw it, he loved it, he ate it." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Joy add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "And the wild things roared their terrible roars and gnashed their terrible teeth and rolled their terrible eyes and showed their terrible claws." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Joy add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "And [he] sailed back over a year and in and out of weeks and through a day and into the night of his very own room where he found his supper waiting for him and it was still hot" -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Joy add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "I cry a lot because I miss people. They die and I can't stop them. They leave me and I love them more." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Joy add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "Sipping once, sipping twice, sipping chicken soup with rice." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Joy add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "Then from far away across the world he smelled good things to eat, so he gave up being king of the wild things." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Joy add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "Each month is gay, Each season nice, When eating Chicken soup With rice" -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Joy add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "You never have to change anything you got up in the middle of the night to write." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Joy add a quote by Frank O'Hara
item.description: "Now I am quietly waiting for the catastrophe of my personality to seem beautiful again, and interesting, and modern." -- Frank O'Hara
